content: left to right needle remove marker slip 4 sts back to left needle replace marker on right needle k2tog *yo k2tog* repeat row 1 rs wyif slip_stitch pwise move yarn to back k1 from * to * to end of row yo k1 4 sts note after replacing the marker make sure row 2 ws knit to last cc st k2tog with next you do not start the eyelet sequence with a mc st from edge yo which may be a natural impulse for lace knitters row 3 wyif slip_stitch pwise move yarn to back k2 yo k1 5 sts repeat row 1-4 until you have 35 eyelet holes in a single row ending with a row 3 ws row 4 repeat row 2 next rs k2 yo knit to m remove m k22 pm row 5 wyif slip_stitch pwise move yarn to back k3 yo *k2tog yo* repeat to last 2 sts k2tog k1 6 sts repeat row 1-4 until you have 35 eyelet holes in a row 6 repeat row 2 single row again ending with a row 3 ws row 7 wyif slip_stitch pwise move yarn to back k4 yo next rs k2 yo knit to m remove m k22 pm k1 7 sts *k2tog yo* repeat to last 2 sts k2tog row 8 repeat row 2 continue with row 1-4 until you run out of yarn ending with a row 2 on the final row remove row 9 wyif slip_stitch pwise move yarn to back k5 yo marker when you come to it you should be at the k1 8 sts bottom point cut mc leaving a tail for weaving in row 10 bobble 5 sts loosely k1 k2tog with mc edge st 3 sts repeat row 1-10 until 1 mc st remains on ws row bobble to last 2 sts k2tog psso tie off weave in ends #sillyheartshawl sillyheart shawl pg 5 blocking resources block your shawl by soaking it in warm water for an hour if you are worried about your yarn bleed- knit-on edge ing then skip this step thread your blocking wires https //www lavisch com/site/knitted-on-border/ through the points and pin into place or just pin the individual points into place if you don t have wires if you didn t soak your shawl then use a spray bottle with cold water and dampen the shawl as you pin it out spread the rest of the shawl into shape pin it and let it fully dry the tail will curl naturally after you unpin it 127 cm / 50 #sillyheartshawl 53 / mc 98 cast on tink noitcerid knit direction abbreviations pg 6 beg = beginning psso = passover bobble = bind off pu = pick up bor = beginning of round pwise = purlwise cc = contrasting colour rem = remaining circ s = circular needle s repeat = repeat cn = cable needle rev st st = reverse stockinette stitch co = cast on round s = round s dpn
